content: did some cosmetic changes

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I find this is a very good contribution, not too hard for the reverse and can be optimised for the shorter code too.
Please, replace this sentance "Spaces and other non-alpha characters to be ignored." by "Spaces and non-alpha characters had to be ignored."
Nice one for a clash. As suggested by @lopidav and @dowe, please make the necessary changes. Please correct the string size in stub to 256 as said by @dowe.

100% SHOULD NOT BE APPROVED until all of the following points are addressed:

- Anything011 pointed out that in the test there are no non-alpha characters other than spaces. It's extremely crucial for shortest mode since you are leaving players guessing if you included other non-alpha characters in the validators or if your statement is wrong.
That's very bad. It may not seem so crucial at first glance but it is. 

- Gilad-Gur-Andelman pointed out that variable names do not make sense. I'll expand on that:
Given string in the Statement is called "S", in the input it's "n".
In the statement the name of the string "S" is not decorated, chars "A" and "B" are not decorated as cell, nowhere is specified that A and B are not strings.
Variable "a" is referred to only in the output and nowhere else.

- dowe pointed out that stub doesn't match Constrains.
Also, you need to use "≤" instead of "<"  in the constraints.
And you need to put dots at the ends of the sentences in the Statement.


Please, do not approve until those points are fixed. As it is the puzzle is simply doesn't work in Fastest and Shortest.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This was a very clear problem, there were no mixups in the directions, and I was able to solve it in c++ in 6 minutes, I would have solved it faster if I was more focused, but I do believe that this is a very good clash. It would work very well in shortest.

You say that "Spaces and other non-alpha characters to be ignored" but none of the tests or validators have non-alpha characters (except spaces). The given solution checks for this but the only thing it actually has to worry about is spaces.
My suggestion is for some tests and validators to have commas, exclamation marks, etc..
Stub seems to be wrong: string size should be 256

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is a pretty easy and fun puzzle to solve in a fastest mode. Might also consider doing a Reverse mode version of it.

Might be considered for golf code?

from string import ascii_uppercase as u
print(sum(u.index(a)for a in input() if a in u))
You should consider adding this to reverse mode as well. Think it would work nicely

Nice clash you created there.
I have some comments:

1. as @eclep wrote, the goal statement can be clearer. Suggestion:
"Print the total sum of alphabet position (zero-based index) all the characters in the given string S". And give as an example "A's index is 0 and B's index is 1".

2. The input string should be named 'S' or 's', because 'n' is usually reserved for lengths variables.
I suggest defining the input like this:
Input
1 Line: S, A string of length n.

3. The output has a typo. It should be:
Output
1 Line: An integer a

4. In the Constraints section, you use 'len(n)'. This is clear to those who know Python, but not all code in Python and will understand right away... This will give an unfair advantage to Python players. Instead, I suggest:
Constraints
1 < n < 256
(remember we defined n in the Input section already)

5. Why only uppercase?
Give the users a mixed string of upper and lowercase to add some (not much though) complexity and challenge.
Still, this should apply a=A=0, b=B=1, etc.

Again, nice work and good luck :)
cool !
The statement could be clearer, something like "the sum of position in the alphabet" rather than "the total index in the alphabet". Also you should clearly state that the index is zero-based
yeah I was thinking the same

Don't use a such verbose programming language for code golf...

echo $(($(tr -dc [A-Z]|hexdump -ve '/1 "+%d-65"')))

Sorry @lopidav i havent had much time to edit this as i am very busy.
Thanks for the comments tho :)
No problem at all. You are doing good
